blocks.name: crpm
blocks.content: Syntax for the ring primes function.

blocks.name: df-rprm
blocks.content: Define the function associating with a ring its set of prime elements. A prime element is a nonzero non-unit that satisfies an equivalent of Euclid's lemma ~ euclemma . Prime elements are closely related to irreducible elements (see ~ df-irred ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-rprm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(crpm, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), crab(s2, cdif(cv(s1), cun(cfv(cui, cv(s0)), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s0))))), wral(s3, cv(s1), wral(s4, cv(s1), wsbc(s5, cfv(cdsr, cv(s0)), wi(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s5), co(cv(s3), cfv(cmulr, cv(s0)), cv(s4))), wo(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s5), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s5), cv(s4)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:

  ‚ä¢ RPrime =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(Base ` s0)/ s1]{ s2 ‚àà(s1 \((Unit ` s0)‚ãÉ {(0 ` s0)}))| ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s1,[(||r ` s0)/ s5](s2[s5](s3[(√ó ` s0)]s4)‚Üí(s2[s5]s3 ‚à® s2[s5]s4))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s5)

}
